Award.AwardTitle: SusChEM: Focus on Sustainability-Integrated Approaches to Materials for Sustainable Development
Award.AbstractNarration:
Non-technical Abstract
Materials science will play a pivotal role in solving many of the key challenges facing our society by providing a sustainable supply of energy, water, products, services, transportation, buildings, and public infrastructure. The development of materials for these applications will require new approaches and researchers who have technical expertise and who understand the complex interrelationships between materials science and other disciplines. As the premier professional society for materials researchers, the Materials Research Society (MRS) is well positioned to help its members address these challenges, and with support from the Division of Materials research, special MRS programming and activities focused on sustainable development will be held at the 2016 MRS Spring Meeting & Exhibit in Phoenix, Arizona (March 28-April 1, 2016). In the near term, this effort will seed future activities and events at MRS Meetings as well as publications that put the materials and sustainability nexus in the spotlight, so as to promote expansion of meaningful research and development efforts. In the long term, the project will encourage students and young researchers, and their faculty, to view sustainability as an important challenge.

Technical Abstract
With support from the Division of Materials Research, the 2016 MRS Spring Meeting & Exhibit in Phoenix, Arizona (March 28-April 1, 2016) will feature "Focus on Sustainability" programming and activities including: (1) a two-day symposium and poster session entitled "Materials for Sustainable Development-Integrated Approaches" that will provide a medium for technically based, interdisciplinary discussions of core materials technologies and their connection with societal, ecological, and economic drivers for sustainable development, and which includes a special half-day session focused on sustainability in industry; (2) a half-day tutorial on how to teach the role of materials in sustainable development; (3) a 90-minute professional development seminar on how to integrate interdisciplinary sustainability principles into materials research; (4) a special University Chapter student poster competition on "Sustainability in My Community;" and (5) public outreach and meeting attendee engagement. The "Focus on Sustainability" program represents an investment towards building a robust community of practice around materials and sustainability.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Materials science will play a pivotal role in solving many of the key challenges our society will continue to face in the coming years, including providing a sustainable supply of energy, water, products, services, transportation, buildings, and public infrastructure. New approaches to sustainable development will require materials researchers who have technical expertise and who understand the complex interrelationships between materials science and other disciplines. As the premier professional society for materials researchers, the Materials Research Society (MRS) is well positioned to help its members address these challenges.

Intellectual Merit: This award supported a successful suite of sustainability programming at the 2016 MRS Spring Meeting, including (1) a symposium entitled “Materials for Sustainable Development—Integrated Approaches,” featuring nearly more than 70 technical talks and poster presentations as well as an industry panel discussion, (2) a half-day tutorial on how to teach the role of materials in sustainable development, (3) a 90-minute professional development seminar on how to integrate interdisciplinary sustainability principles into materials research, (4) a University Chapter student poster exhibition on “Sustainability in My Community, and (5) public outreach and meeting attendee engagement, including special features at a Focus on Sustainability informational booth, free outreach resources, hands-on activities, and stage presentations.

In addition, the funds supported a second technical symposium at the 2017 MRS Fall Meeting on “Materials Efficiency to Enable a Circular Materials Economy” and a full-day tutorial on “Sustainable Development of Materials” at that same meeting. The professional development seminar, mentioned above, has been offered at every MRS Fall and Spring Meeting since the 2016 Spring Meeting. The award also supported two highly successful moderated panel discussions on “Materials Needs for Energy Sustainability by 2050,” which drew an average of 300 attendees, placing it in the top 10% of events at the MRS meetings. The Focus on Sustainability informational booth, first established at the 2016 Spring Meeting, has fostered dozens of conversations with MRS meeting attendees and has drawn more than 350 MRS members to fill out a more detailed survey about their sustainability interests and ways in which they’d like to be engaged on this topic with MRS.

Broader Impacts: Shifting materials scientists’ perceptions of and approaches to sustainable development will require a concerted effort that builds over time. The Focus on Sustainability program represents an investment towards building a robust community of practice around materials and sustainability. Towards that end, this award seeded the establishment of the Focus on Sustainability subcommittee as an official operating subcommittee of the Public Outreach committee of MRS. The subcommittee now serves as a hub for planning sustainability programming at each MRS meeting as well as engaging with MRS publications and outreach efforts on sustainability topics.

Throughout the duration of the award, we balanced our programming to span and target a wide array of audiences, including K-12 students, the general public, undergraduate and graduate students, faculty, and industry. We also made a point to include women, early career scientists, underrepresented minorities, and international representatives among our organizing committee, symposium presenters, and tutorial and professional development seminar instructors.
